Backup copies of DVD9 games dont work in the ps2..even if u have the latest version of the PS2 and the best chip wich support DVD9..the problem is not the ps2, the media, the chip or the burning software..the only big problem is the way to burn them onto the media..dvds (DVD5 and DVD9) can be burned in 2 ways: OTP (Opposite Track path, used for DVD videos) and PTP (parallel track path, used for DVD9 games)..the problem is DVD+R DL medias are only OTP..the only way to burn (press) DVD9 game disc in PTP mode is with a factory pressing machine (the one that sony and many other compagnies use for games/dvd movies) and there is no way yet to change from OTP to PTP and vice versa..in order to play dvd9 games is rip it onto 2 dvd5 or just buy the original
